intro: Craspedia gracilis, commonly known as the slender craspedia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions. Its small, yellow flowers are surrounded by pale green ray florets, creating a distinctive appearance. Craspedia gracilis is often found in heathlands and open woodlands, where it contributes to the local biodiversity.
